alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 4:17PM PDT until June 27 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Washington, including the following county, Okanogan. * WHEN...Until 700 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 414 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms developing near and just east of Conconully. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. If near the Muckamuck burn scar, prepare to move to higher ground if heavy rainfall occurs. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Omak, Riverside, Conconully and Alder Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
